com.remote.remote2d.engine.art

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.remote.remote2d.engine.art.Animation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    R2DFileSaver

    public class Animation
extends java.lang.Object
implements R2DFileSaver
    Sprite-based Animation system. Animations work on a grid-based Spritesheet system. This means that each frame in a spritesheet must:
    • Be equal in size
    • Be equally spaced apart
    • Form a 2-dimensional grid at least 1 row high and 1 row long
    Remote2D offers a sprite optimization tool to convert non-conforming spritesheets to a neat grid format. NOTE: There can be more than one spritesheet on one image. This can help save space and memory.
    Author:
    Flafla2

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean animate
      If this is false the animation does not advance frames when rendering
      boolean flippedX
      If this is true, flips the sprite along the X-axis.
      boolean flippedY
      If this is true, flips the sprite along the Y-axis.

    • Field Detail

      • animate

        public boolean animate
        If this is false the animation does not advance frames when rendering

      • flippedX

        public boolean flippedX
        If this is true, flips the sprite along the X-axis. Useful for sprites which are identical for the "walk left" and "walk right" animations, etc.
        See Also:
        flippedY

      • flippedY

        public boolean flippedY
        If this is true, flips the sprite along the Y-axis.
        See Also:
        flippedX

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animation

        public Animation(java.lang.String texPath,
         Vector2 startPos,
         Vector2 spriteDim,
         Vector2 padding,
         Vector2 frames,
         int framelength)
        All parameters pertain to the sprite's dimensions on the actual IMAGE, not in game while rendering.
        Parameters:
        texPath - Path to the animation's texture
        startPos - Starting position of the sprite grid.
        spriteDim - Dimensions of each individual frame of the animation.
        padding - Padding in between each sprite
        frames - Number of frames in the X and Y axis. The animation system iterates from left to right -> up to down.
        framelength - How long each frame is, in milliseconds.

      • Animation

        public Animation(java.lang.String path)
        Parameters:
        path - Path to any Animation ".anim" file to load from, relative to the jar path

      • getPath

        public java.lang.String getPath()

      • render

        public void render(Vector2 pos,
          Vector2 dim)
        Renders this animation. Note: The animation WILL stretch if the dimensions are not proportional!
        Parameters:
        pos - Position (top left corner) to render
        dim - Dimensions of rendered sprite
        See Also:
        render(Vector2, Vector2, int, float)

      • render

        public void render(Vector2 pos,
          Vector2 dim,
          int color,
          float alpha)
        Renders this animation. Note: The animation WILL stretch if the dimensions are not proportional!
        Parameters:
        pos - Position (top left corner) to render
        dim - Dimensions of rendered sprite
        color - Color (in hex) to render as. For example 0xff5555 will render as a red tint
        alpha - How opaque it is (0.0-1.0)
        See Also:
        render(Vector2, Vector2)

      • getFrames

        public Vector2 getFrames()
        How many frames there are on the sprite sheet, in both X and Y directions. For example, if there are 10 frames, with 5 frames on each row on the sprite sheet, this would be put (5,2)

      • setFrames

        public void setFrames(Vector2 frames)
        How many frames there are on the sprite sheet, in both X and Y directions. For example, if there are 10 frames, with 5 frames on each row on the sprite sheet, this would be put (5,2)

      • setLastFrameTime

        public void setLastFrameTime(long lastFrameTime)
        Set the time when the last frame rendered, in ms. This can be used to reset the animation to the beginning of the current frame.

      • renderFrames

        public void renderFrames()
        Renders the position of every frame (on the spritesheet) as a green box. Useful for debugging purposes.
